intro: Rubus verae-crucis, commonly known as the Cross of Christ raspberry, is a species of bramble native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems, trifoliate leaves, and small, aggregate fruits that ripen in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowers are white with five petals and are visited by various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. The fruit, while edible, is often described as having a tart and slightly astringent flavor.
